state_analysis: The Makefile was successfully created and the compilation command was executed, but it failed because the object files (my_lib.o and test_main.o) do not exist. This indicates that the compilation step for the source files did not occur as intended.
explanation: I will modify the Makefile to ensure that it correctly compiles the Fortran source files to create the object files before linking them into the final executable. Then, I will re-run the make command to compile the project and generate the test program.

commands.keystrokes:
echo -e 'FC=gfortran
OBJ=my_lib.o test_main.o
all: $(OBJ)
\t$(FC) -o test_program $(OBJ)
my_lib.o: my_lib.f90
\t$(FC) -c my_lib.f90
test_main.o: test_main.f90
\t$(FC) -c test_main.f90
clean:
\trm -f *.o test_program' > src/Makefile
